Summary I consider myself an industrious, creative, self starter, who enjoys public speaking and personal development. I have enjoyed my progressive Administrative career and look forward to what the future offers while aspiring to my continuing educational goals. 
 
I have worked with computers and applications since 1987. During my various enterprising experiences I have built, tested components and computer systems. The breadth of employment has led me across many business channels, through various marketing groups, working hand in hand throughout the Admin community and leadership organization.  
 
By providing high quality service in my Admin role, for over fifteen years, I have delivered an infallible travel coordination record. My motto is, "If presentation is everything, then follow through is second to none." What I am seeking as an Executive Assistant Office Administrator, is a position that will allow me to grow, develop, train, form genuine high quality professional interpersonal relationships and support a team while striving daily to meet company mission business objectives.  
 
On personal time, I have sought out projects that will enhance community livability, such as successfully spearheading a $75K pedestrian/bike bridge adjacent to a local roadway. In addition, proposing solutions for upgrading integrated equipment and services to a local Senior-Disabilities transportation organization.  
 
My most recent accomplishment as Project Chair for the Portland Woman's Club and child abuse prevention advocacy, is the signed Proclamation by Governor Kate Brown, for "Pinwheels for Prevention Day" April 8th, 2015. 
 
I look forward to meeting you in business and success. 
 
With Warm Regards, 
Melissa D. Nourigat

My motto is, "If presentation is everything, then follow through is second to none." What I am seeking as an Executive Assistant Office Administrator, is a position that will allow me to grow, develop, train, form genuine high quality professional interpersonal relationships and support a team while striving daily to meet company mission business objectives.  
 
On personal time, I have sought out projects that will enhance community livability, such as successfully spearheading a $75K pedestrian/bike bridge adjacent to a local roadway. In addition, proposing solutions for upgrading integrated equipment and services to a local Senior-Disabilities transportation organization.  
 
My most recent accomplishment as Project Chair for the Portland Woman's Club and child abuse prevention advocacy, is the signed Proclamation by Governor Kate Brown, for "Pinwheels for Prevention Day" April 8th, 2015. 
 
I look forward to meeting you in business and success.
